summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things were created through Him, and without Him nothing was created that was created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light shines in darkness, but the darkness has not overcome it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man sent from God whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man came as a witness in order to testify concerning the Light, that all men through Him might believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was not this Light, but was sent in order to testify concerning the Light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The true Light, which enlightens everyone, was coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was created through Him, yet the world did not know Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to His own, and His own people did not receive Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet to all who received Him, He gave the power to become sons of God, to those who believed in His name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw His glory, the glory as the only Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John bore witness of Him and cried out, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have all received from His fullness grace upon grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has seen God at any time. The only Son, who is at the Father’s side, has made Him known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked him, “Who then? Are you Elijah?”
He said, “I am not.”
“Are you the Prophet?”
He answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him then, “Who are you? Tell us so that we may give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say concerning yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ just as the prophet Isaiah said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Why do you baptize then, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, “I baptize with water, but One stands among you, whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is He who comes after me, who is preferred before me, the strap of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know Him, but for this reason I came baptizing with water: so that He might be revealed to Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The One on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen and have borne witness that He is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the next day John was standing with two of his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking upon Jesus as He walked, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus turned, saw them following, and said to them, “What do you seek?”
And they said to Him, “Rabbi” (which means Teacher), “where are You staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Come and see.”
So they came and saw where He stayed and remained with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which means the Christ).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he brought him to Jesus.
When Jesus saw him, He said, “You are Simon the son of John. You shall be called Cephas” (which means Peter).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip, and said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, as well as the prophets, wrote, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?”
Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him and said concerning him, “Here is an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?”
Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He said to him, “Truly, truly I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does this have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six water pots made of stone were sitting there, used for ceremonial cleansing by the Jews, containing twenty to thirty gallons each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Then He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the master of the feast.”
And they took it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the master of the feast tasted the water that had been turned into wine, and did not know where it came from (though the servants who drew the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, “Every man serves the good wine first, and after men have drunk freely, then the poor wine is served. But you have kept the good wine until now.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This, the first of His signs, Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and He revealed His glory, and His disciples believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this He, and His mother, and His brothers, and His disciples went down to Capernaum. They remained there a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the temple He found those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the moneychangers sitting there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and oxen. He poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My Father’s house a house of merchandise!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house will consume Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “What sign do You show us, seeing that You do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He was speaking concerning the temple of His body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them. And they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many believed in His name when they saw the signs which He did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus did not entrust Himself to them, because He knew all men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not need anyone to bear witness of man, for He knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher who has come from God. For no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless a man is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless a man is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear its sound, but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can this be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, but you do not know these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, We speak of what We know and bear witness of what We have seen, but you do not receive Our testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one has ascended to heaven except He who descended from heaven, even the Son of Man who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but may have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who believes in Him is not condemned. But he who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This is the verdict, that light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who does evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that it may be revealed that his deeds have been done in God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea. He remained with them there and baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John also was baptizing in Aenon toward Salim, because much water was there. And people came and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had not yet been put in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a dispute arose between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about ceremonial cleansing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you bore witness, look, He is baptizing, and everyone is going to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves bear witness of me, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but ‘I have been sent before Him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly at the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who comes from above is above all. He who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He bears witness of what He has seen and heard, yet no one receives His testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without measure to Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son, and has placed all things into His hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who believes in the Son has eternal life. He who does not believe the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when the Lord learned that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was necessary that He go through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus, therefore, being exhausted from His journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman of Samaria came there to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a woman of Samaria?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who is saying to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, along with his sons and his livestock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him will never thirst. Indeed, the water that I shall give him will become in him a well of water springing up into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not thirst, nor come here to draw.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman answered, “I have no husband.”
Jesus said to her, “You are right in saying, ‘I have no husband,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have had five husbands, and he whom you now have is not your husband. So you have spoken truthfully.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers worshipped on this mountain, but you all say that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the hour is coming, and is now here, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth. For the Father seeks such to worship Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples came. They marveled that He talked with a woman. Yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman then left her water pot, went her way into the city, and said to the men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out of the city and came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “I have food to eat of which you do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the disciples said one to another, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months, and then comes the harvest’? Listen! I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, for they are already white for harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit that leads to eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this is the saying true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to reap a crop for which you did not labor. And you have benefited from their labor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans came to Him, they asked Him to remain with them. And He stayed there two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many more believed because of His word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we have heard for ourselves and know that this Man is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when He came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed Him, having seen all the things He did at Jerusalem at the feast. For they had also gone to the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him, pleading that He would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nobleman said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.”
And the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was going down, his servants met him and told him, “Your son lives!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he inquired of them the hour when he began to heal, they answered, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” So he and his whole household believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the second sign that Jesus did when He had come from Judea to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate there is a pool, which in Hebrew is called Bethesda, having five porches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these lay a great crowd of invalids, blind, lame, and paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water. After the stirring of the water, whoever stepped in first was healed of whatever disease he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain man was there who had an illness for thirty-eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been in that condition now a long time, He said to him, “Do you want to be healed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred. But while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Rise, take up your bed and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Immediately the man was healed, took up his bed, and walked.
That day was the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath day. It is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “He who healed me said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, as there was a crowd in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See, you have become whole. Sin no more lest something worse happens to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews persecuted Jesus and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “My Father is working still, and I am working.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews sought even more to kill Him, because He not only had broken the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do. For whatever He does, likewise the Son does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows Him all things that He Himself does. And He will show Him greater works than these so that you may marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son gives life to whom He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that all men should honor the Son, just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, truly I say to you, whoever hears My word and believes in Him who sent Me has eternal life and shall not come into condemnation, but has passed from death into life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, the hour is coming, and is now here, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father has life in Himself, so He has given to the Son to have life in Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not marvel at this. For the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and come out—those who have done good to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil to the resurrection of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can do nothing of Myself. As I hear, I judge. My judgment is just, because I seek not My own will, but the will of the Father who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I bear witness of Myself, My testimony is not true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the testimony which He bears of Me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You sent to John, and he bore witness of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a burning and a shining lamp, and you were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have greater testimony than that of John. The works which the Father has given Me to finish, the very works that I do, bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father Himself, who has sent Me, has borne witness of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not have His word abiding in you, for you do not believe the One He has sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You search the Scriptures, because you think in them you have eternal life. These are they who bear witness of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not receive honor from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in My Father’s name, but you do not receive Me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another and do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not think that I shall accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you—Moses, in whom you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me, for he wrote of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus went across the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great crowd followed Him, because they saw His signs which He did for the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went up on a mountain, and He sat there with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus looked up and saw a great crowd coming to Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread that these may eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for each of them to receive but a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fish. But what are they among so many?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, numbering about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then took the loaves, and when He had given thanks, He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; and likewise, they distributed the fish, as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were filled, He told His disciples, “Collect the fragments that remain, that nothing may be lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they collected them and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those men saw the sign which He had done, they then said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, knowing that they would come and take Him by force to make Him king, Jesus departed again to a mountain by Himself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got into a boat and went across the sea toward Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sea was stirred up because a strong wind was blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat. And they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they gladly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day the people who stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but that His disciples had gone away alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, other boats came from Tiberias near the place where they ate bread when the Lord had given thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people therefore saw that neither Jesus nor His disciples were there, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you, you seek Me not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not work for the food which perishes, but for that food which endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For God the Father has set His seal on Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked Him, “What shall we do that we may work the works of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they said to Him, “What sign do You show then, that we may see and believe You? What work will You perform?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers ate manna in the desert. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Truly, truly I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to Me shall never hunger, and whoever believes in Me shall never thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I told you that you have seen Me, and yet do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All whom the Father gives Me will come to Me, and he who comes to Me I will never cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I came down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the will of the Father who has sent Me, that of all whom He has given Me, I should lose nothing, but should raise it up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him may have eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews then murmured about Him, because He said, “I am the bread which came down from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, ‘I have come down from heaven’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered them, “Do not murmur among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can come to Me unless the Father who has sent Me draws him. And I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the Prophets, ‘They shall all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who has heard and has learned of the Father comes to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God. He has seen the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, whoever believes in Me has eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the bread of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers ate manna in the wilderness, and they died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. The bread which I shall give for the life of the world is My flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life. And I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood remains in Me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so whoever feeds on Me also will live because of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread which came down from heaven, not as your fathers ate manna and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said these things in the synagogue, as He taught in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, many of His disciples said, “This is a hard saying. Who can listen to it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowing in Himself that His disciples murmured about it, Jesus said to them, “Does this offend you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what if you see the Son of Man ascend to where He was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit and are life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said, “For this reason I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it were given him by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time many of His disciples went back and walked no more with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have believed and have come to know that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have I not chosen you, the twelve, and yet one of you is a devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon. For it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee. He would not walk in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one does anything in secret, while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, reveal Yourself to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even His brothers did not believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Jesus told them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always fitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you. But it hates Me, because I testify concerning it, that its works are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast yet, because My time has not yet fully come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, after His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He also went up, not publicly, but secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews looked for Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There was much complaining among the people concerning Him. For some said, “He is a good Man.”
Others said, “No, He deceives the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and began teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews marveled, saying, “How has this Man become educated, having never been taught?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “My teaching is not Mine, but His who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man desires to do His will, he shall know whether the teaching is from God or whether I speak on My own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who speaks on his own authority seeks his own glory. But He who seeks the glory of Him who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Moses not give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, because Moses gave you circumcision, you circumcise a man on the Sabbath day (although it did not come from Moses, but from the Patriarchs).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath day, so that the Law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry at Me because I completely healed a man on the Sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not judge according to appearance, but practice righteous judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! He speaks publicly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers indeed know that this is really the Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we know where this Man is from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where He is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, still teaching in the temple, cried out, “You know Me and you likewise know where I am from. I have not come on My own authority, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they tried to seize Him, but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still, many of the people believed in Him and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than these which this Man has done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning Him. So the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to arrest Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I shall be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said among themselves, “Where does He intend to go that we shall not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What kind of saying is this which He said, ‘You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his heart shall flow rivers of living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this He spoke of the Spirit, whom those who believe in Him would receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when they heard these words, many of the people said, “Truly, this is the Prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others said, “This is the Christ.”
But some said, “Will the Christ come out of Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has the Scripture not said that the Christ comes from the seed of David, out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division among the people because of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them wanted to arrest Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers answered, “No man has ever spoken like this Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed in Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not at all. This crowd who does not know the law is accursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, being one of them who came to Jesus by night, said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone went to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning He returned to the temple. All the people came to Him, and He sat down and taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery. When they had put her in the middle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses in the law commanded us to stone such, but what do You say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said this, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him.
But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they continued asking Him, He stood up and said to them, “Let him who is without sin among you be the first to throw a stone at her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being convicted by their conscience, those who heard it went out one by one, beginning with the eldest even to the last. Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had stood up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She said, “No one, Lord.”
Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you. Go and sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows Me shall not walk in the darkness, but shall have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself. Your testimony is not true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Though I bear witness of Myself, My testimony is true. For I know where I came from and where I am going. But you do not know where I came from or where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if I do judge, My judgment is true. For I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in your law it is written that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father that sent Me bears witness of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?”
Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you knew Me, you would know My Father also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as He taught in the temple. No one arrested Him, for His hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, Jesus said to them, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and you will die in your sins. Where I am going, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself? For He said, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to Him, “Who are You?”
Jesus said to them, “Just who I have been telling you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true. So I tell the world what I heard from Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and I do nothing of Myself. But I speak these things as My Father taught Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him, “If you remain in My word, then you are truly My disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s seed and have never been in bondage to anyone. Why do You say, ‘You shall be set free’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you, whoever commits sin is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a slave does not remain in the house forever, but a son remains forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if the Son sets you free, you shall be free indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that you are Abraham’s seed. But you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling what I have seen with My Father, and you are doing what you have seen with your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered Him, “Abraham is our father.”
Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are doing the works of your father.”
Then they said to Him, “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father: God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I came from God and proceeded into the world. I did not come of My own authority, but He sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you not understand My speaking? Because you cannot bear to hear My word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks from his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet because I tell the truth, you do not believe Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of you convicts Me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is of God hears God’s words. Therefore, you do not hear them, because you are not of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Him, “Do we not rightly say that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon. But I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not seek glory for Myself. There is One who seeks it and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, if anyone keeps My word, he shall never see death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham and the prophets died, and You say, ‘If a man keeps My word, he shall never taste death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are You greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets are dead! Who do You make Yourself out to be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing. It is My Father who glorifies Me, of whom you say that He is your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. If I say, ‘I do not know Him,’ I shall be a liar like you. But I know Him and keep His word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day. He saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old. Have You seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, before Abraham was born, I AM.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took up stones to throw at Him. But Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple. Going through their midst, He passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus passed by, He saw a man blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked Him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned. But it happened so that the works of God might be displayed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must do the works of Him who sent Me while it is day. Night is coming when no one can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva. He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means “Sent”). So he went away and washed, and returned seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The neighbors and those who had previously seen that he was blind said, “Is this not he who sat and begged?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some said, “This is he.”
Others said, “He is like him.”
But he said, “I am he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “A Man called Jesus made clay, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to him, “Where is He?”
He said, “I do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the man who had been blind to the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath day.”
Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” So there was division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him, since He opened your eyes?”
He said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of the one who had received his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked them, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents answered them, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how he now sees, we do not know, or who opened his eyes, we do not know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents said this, because they feared the Jews. For the Jews had already agreed that if anyone confessed that He was the Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So again they called the man who was blind and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this Man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I do not know if He is a sinner. I know one thing: I was blind, but now I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they insulted him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses. As for this fellow, we do not know where He is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered, “Well, here is an amazing thing! You do not know where He is from, and yet He opened my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God does not listen to sinners. But if anyone is a worshipper of God and does His will, He hears him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the world began, it has never been heard that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “You were completely born in sin. Are you teaching us?” And they threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when He found him, He said, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have seen Him, and it is He who speaks with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Lord, I believe.” And he worshipped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may become blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we also blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “If you were blind, you would have no sin. But now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, truly I say to you, he who does not enter by the door into the sheepfold, but climbs up some other way, is a thief and a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and he leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them. And the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him. For they do not know the voice of strangers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what He was telling them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “Truly, truly I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the door. If anyone enters through Me, he will be saved and will go in and out and find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief does not come, except to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down His life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, and leaves the sheep, and runs away. So the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired hand runs away because he is a hired hand and does not care about the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. I know My sheep and am known by My own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as the Father knows Me, so I know the Father. And I lay down My life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have other sheep who are not of this fold. I must also bring them, and they will hear My voice. There will be one flock and one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it up again. I received this command from My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of them said, “He has a demon and is insane. Why do you listen to Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Feast of the Dedication was at Jerusalem, and it was winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s Porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews surrounded Him, saying, “How long will You keep us in suspense? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you did not believe. The works that I do in My Father’s name bear witness of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give them eternal life. They shall never perish, nor shall anyone snatch them from My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them from My Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father and I are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Jews took up stones to stone Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Him, “We are not stoning You for a good work, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, claim to be God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do you say of Him, whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am not doing the works of My Father, do not believe Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I do them, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again they tried to seize Him, but He escaped from their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and He remained there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many came to Him and said, “John did no sign. But everything that John said about this Man was true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sisters sent word to Him, saying, “Lord, he whom You love is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified by it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when He heard that he was sick, He remained where He was two more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after this He said to the disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to Him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone You. Are You going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks during the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone walks during the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After He said this, He said to them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep. But I am going that I may awaken him from sleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples said, “Lord, if he is sleeping, he will be well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had spoken of his death. But they thought that He was speaking of getting rest through sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then Jesus plainly told them, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Thomas, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go also, that we may die with Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus arrived, He found that he had been in the tomb four days already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, less than two miles away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met Him, but Mary remained in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even now I know that whatever You may ask of God, God will give You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, yet shall he live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever lives and believes in Me shall never die. Do you believe this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had said this, she went her way and secretly called her sister Mary, saying, “The Teacher has come and is calling for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she heard this, she rose quickly and went to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was in the place where Martha met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Jews who were with Mary in the house, comforting her, saw that she quickly rose up and went out, they followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Where have you laid him?”
They said to Him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “See how He loved him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind man, have also kept this man from dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, again groaning within Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Take away the stone.”
Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not tell you that if you believed, you would see the glory of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that You always hear Me. But because of the people standing around, I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He cried out with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who was dead came out, his hands and feet wrapped with grave clothes, and his face wrapped with a cloth.
Jesus said to them, “Unbind him, and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of the Jews who came to Mary, and saw what Jesus had done, believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled the Sanhedrin and said, “What shall we do? This Man is performing many signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we leave Him alone like this, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our temple and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them named Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, that the whole nation should not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not say this on his own authority. But being the high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not for the nation only, but that He might also gather together in unity the children of God who were scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that day forward they planned to put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went away from there to the country near the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and remained there with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up to Jerusalem from the country before the Passover to purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they searched for Jesus and said among themselves as they stood in the temple, “What do you think, that He will not come to the feast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days before the Passover Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They prepared a supper for Him there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took a pint of very costly ointment made from pure nard, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who would betray Him, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief. And having the money box, he used to steal what was put in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of My burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When many of the Jews learned that He was there, they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priests planned to put Lazarus to death also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day a great crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They took branches of palm trees, and went out to meet Him, and cried out:
“Hosanna!
‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’
The King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: His disciples did not understand these things at first. But when Jesus was glorified, they remembered that these things were written about Him and that they had done these things to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the crowd that was with Him when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead bore witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd went and met Him for this reason: They heard that He had performed this sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees said among themselves, “See, you are gaining nothing! Look, the world has followed Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who loves his life will lose it. And he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone serves Me, he must follow Me. Where I am, there will My servant be also. If anyone serves Me, the Father will honor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now My soul is troubled. What shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? Instead, for this reason I came to this hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, glorify Your name.”
Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd that stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “This voice came not for My sake, but for your sakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now judgment is upon this world. Now the ruler of this world will be cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator
