verses.text: And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men to Myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to signify by what kind of death He would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever. Why do You say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Yet a little while the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you. He who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you have light, believe in the light that you may become sons of light.” Jesus said these things, and departed and hid Himself from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though He had done so many signs before them, yet they did not believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This fulfilled the word spoken by Isaiah the prophet:
“Lord, who has believed our report,
    and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they could not believe. For Isaiah said again:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has blinded their eyes
    and hardened their hearts,
lest they should see with their eyes
    and perceive with their hearts and turn,
    and I would heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said this when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet many of the rulers also believed in Him. But because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried out, “He who believes in Me believes not only in Me, but in Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who sees Me sees Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in Me should not remain in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone hears My words and does not believe, I do not judge him. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who rejects Me, and does not receive My words, has that which judges him. The word I have spoken will judge him on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not spoken on My own authority, but the Father who sent Me gave Me a command, what I should say and what I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that His command is eternal life. Therefore what I say, I say as the Father tells me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the Passover Feast, Jesus knew that His hour had come to depart from this world to the Father. Having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now supper being concluded, the devil had put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands and that He came from God and was going to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rose from supper, laid aside His garments, and took a towel and wrapped Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel with which He was wrapped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to Simon Peter, and Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You washing my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You do not understand what I am doing now. But later you will understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet!”
Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “He who is bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He knew who would betray Him. Therefore He said, “Not all of you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when He had washed their feet, and put on His garments, and sat down again, He said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call Me Teacher and Lord. You speak accurately, for so I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master, nor is he who is sent greater than he who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen, but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now I tell you before it happens, that when it does happen, you may believe that I am He.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives Me. And he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, He was troubled in spirit, and testified, “Truly, truly I say to you that one of you will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples looked at one another, uncertain of whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was leaning against Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples whom Jesus loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Simon Peter motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaning back against Jesus’ bosom, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “It is he to whom I shall give a piece of bread when I have dipped it.” When He had dipped the bread, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After receiving the piece of bread, Satan entered him.
Then Jesus said to him, “What you are going to do, do quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one at the table knew why He said this to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Judas had the moneybox, some thought that Jesus said to him, “Buy what we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having received the piece of bread, he then left immediately. And it was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone out, Jesus then said, “Now is the Son of Man glorified, and in Him God is glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself and will immediately glorify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Little children, yet a little while I am with you. You will seek Me. And as I said to the Jews, so now I tell you, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another, even as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this all men will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?”
Jesus answered him, “Where I am going, you cannot follow Me now. But you shall follow Me afterward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered Him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Truly, truly I say to you, the rooster shall not crow until you have denied Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let not your heart be troubled. You believe in God. Believe also in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In My Father’s house are many dwelling places. If it were not so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to Myself, that where I am, you may be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know where I am going, and you know the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going. How can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also. From now on you do know Him and have seen Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that is sufficient for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? He who has seen Me has seen the Father. So how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in Me? The words that I say to you I do not speak on My own authority. But the Father who lives in Me does the works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe Me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in Me. Or else believe Me on account of the works themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, he who believes in Me will do the works that I do also. And he will do greater works than these, because I am going to My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will do whatever you ask in My name, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love Me, keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Counselor, that He may be with you forever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, for it does not see Him, neither does it know Him. But you know Him, for He lives with you, and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not leave you fatherless. I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little while and the world will see Me no more. But you will see Me. Because I live, you will live also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you are in Me, and I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has My commandments and keeps them is the one who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father. And I will love him and will reveal Myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, how is it that You will reveal Yourself to us, but not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If a man loves Me, he will keep My word. My Father will love him, and We will come to him, and make Our home with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who does not love Me does not keep My words. The word which you hear is not Mine, but the Father’s who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have spoken these things to you while I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, will teach you everything and remind you of all that I told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have heard Me say to you, ‘I am going away and am returning to you.’ If you loved Me, you would rejoice because I said, ‘I am going to the Father,’ for My Father is greater than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this I will not speak much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I do as the Father has commanded Me so that the world may know that I love the Father.
“Rise, let us go from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every branch in Me that bears no fruit, He takes away. And every branch that bears fruit, He prunes, that it may bear more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are already clean through the word which I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, neither can you, unless you remain in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine, you are the branches. He who remains in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit. For without Me you can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man does not remain in Me, he is thrown out as a branch and withers. And they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you remain in Me, and My words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it shall be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As the Father loved Me, I also loved you. Remain in My love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you keep My commandments, you will remain in My love, even as I have kept My Father’s commandments and remain in His love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have spoken these things to you, that My joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is My commandment: that you love one another, as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greater love has no man than this: that a man lay down his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are My friends if you do whatever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I no longer call you servants, for a servant does not know what his master does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I have heard from My Father have I made known to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not choose Me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that the Father may give you whatever you ask Him in My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I command you: that you love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you were of the world, the world would love you as its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, the world therefore hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My words, they will keep yours also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who hates Me hates My Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not performed among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin. But now have they seen and hated both My Father and Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the word which is written in their law might be fulfilled, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Counselor comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will bear witness of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have spoken these things to you so that you will not fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he is offering a service to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do these things to you, because they have not known the Father nor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them.
“I did not tell you these things at the beginning, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am going to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, sorrow has filled your heart because I have told you these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is expedient for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Counselor will not come to you. But if I go, I will send Him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He comes, He will convict the world of sin and of righteousness and of judgment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of sin, because they do not believe in Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of righteousness, because I am going to My Father, and you will see Me no more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of judgment, because the ruler of this world stands condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have yet many things to tell you, but you cannot bear them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Spirit of truth comes, He will guide you into all truth. For He will not speak on His own authority. But He will speak whatever He hears, and He will tell you things that are to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will glorify Me, for He will receive from Me and will declare it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that the Father has is Mine. Therefore I said that He will take what is Mine and will declare it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In a little while you will not see Me. And then after a little while you will see Me, because I am going to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of His disciples said among themselves, “What is this He is telling us: ‘In a little while you will not see Me; and then after a little while you will see Me,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “What is this He is telling us: ‘In a little while’? We do not know what He is saying.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus knew that they wanted to ask Him. So He said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning what I said: ‘In a little while you will not see Me; and then after a little while you will see Me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman is giving birth, she has pain, because her hour has come. But as soon as she delivers the child, she no longer remembers the anguish for joy that a child is born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you now have sorrow. But I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will ask Me nothing. Truly, truly I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name, He will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things in proverbs. But the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in proverbs, for I will speak to you plainly about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will ask in My name. I am not saying to you that I shall ask the Father on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came from the Father and have come into the world. As I said, I am leaving the world and am going to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to Him, “Yes! Now You are speaking plainly and with no figure of speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that You know everything and do not need anyone to question You. By this we believe that You came from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, the hour is coming. Yes, it has now come that you will be scattered, each to his own home, and will leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone, for the Father is with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things so that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But be of good cheer. I have overcome the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Jesus spoke these words, He lifted His eyes toward heaven and said:
“Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son may also glorify You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As You have given Him authority over all flesh, He will give eternal life to all whom You have given Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom You have sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work You have given Me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Father, glorify Me in Your own presence with the glory which I had with You before the world existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have revealed Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, and You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they know that all things You have given Me are from You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given them the words which You gave Me. They have received them and certainly know that I came from You, and they have believed that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray for them. I do not pray for the world, but for those whom You have given Me. For they are Yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that are Mine are Yours, and all that are Yours are Mine. And I am glorified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am to be no longer in the world, though these are in the world, for I am coming to You. Holy Father, through Your name keep those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. I have kept those whom You have given Me. And none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now I am coming to You, and I say these things in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them Your word. And the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should keep them from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify them by Your truth. Your word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As You sent Me into the world, so I sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified by the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not pray for these alone, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they may all be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You. May they also be one in Us, that the world may believe that You have sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them the glory which You gave Me, that they may be one even as We are one:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in them and You in Me, that they may be perfect in unity, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I desire that they also, whom You have given Me, be with Me where I am, that they may see My glory which You have given Me. For You loved Me before the creation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O righteous Father, the world has not known You, but I have known You, and these have known that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have declared Your name to them, and will declare it, that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples across the Kidron Valley. There was a garden which He and His disciples entered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore, knowing everything that would happen to Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom do you seek?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Jesus said to them, “I am He.” And Judas, who betrayed Him, was standing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He said, “I am He,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again Jesus asked them, “Whom do you seek?”
They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I told you that I am He. So then let these go their way if you are looking for Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was to fulfill the word which He had spoken, “I have lost none of those whom You have given Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink the cup which My Father has given Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the detachment of soldiers and the commander and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First they led Him to Annas, for he was the father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. That disciple was known to the high priest and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the servant girl, being the doorkeeper, said to Peter, “Are you not also one of this Man’s disciples?”
He said, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the servants and officers stood there and warmed themselves, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. Peter also stood with them and warmed himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and I said nothing in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you ask Me? Ask those who heard Me and what I have said to them. Certainly they know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Is that how You answer the high priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil, but if well, why do you strike me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meanwhile Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. So they said to him, “Are you not also one of His disciples?”
He denied it and said, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter then denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. It was early. Yet they themselves did not enter the Praetorium, so that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have handed Him over to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate said, “Take Him and judge Him according to your law.”
The Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying what death He would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Pilate entered the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Are you speaking of your own accord, or did others tell you about Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests handed You over to me. What have You done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, then My servants would fight, that I would not be handed over to the Jews. But now My kingdom is not from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Pilate said to Him, “Then are You a king?”
Jesus answered, “You say correctly that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world, to bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no guilt in Him at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all shouted again, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate took Jesus and flogged Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put a purple robe on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they hit Him with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Pilate went out and said to them, “Look, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no guilt in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Here is the Man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”
Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and crucify Him, for I find no guilt in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard these words, he was more afraid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to release You, and power to crucify You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all over Me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who handed Me over to you has the greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on, Pilate tried to release Him. But the Jews cried out, “If you release this Man, you are not Caesar’s friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called The Pavement (which in Hebrew is Gabbatha).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was the Day of Preparation of the Passover and about the sixth hour.
He said to the Jews, “Here is your King!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they shouted, “Away with Him! Away with Him! Crucify Him!”
Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?”
The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he handed Him over to them to be crucified.
So they took Jesus and led Him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out, carrying His own cross, to a place called The Place of a Skull, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. The writing was:
JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. And it was written in Hebrew, in Greek, and in Latin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but ‘He said, I am King of the Jews.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took His garments and divided them into four parts, a part for each soldier; and also His tunic. Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it shall be.”
This happened to fulfill the Scripture which says:
“They divided My garments among them,
    and for My clothing they cast lots.”
Therefore the soldiers did these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But standing by the cross of Jesus were His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw His mother and the disciple whom He loved standing nearby, He said to His mother, “Woman, here is your son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” From that time, this disciple took her to his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus, knowing that everything was now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bowl full of sour wine was placed there. So they put a sponge full of sour wine on hyssop and held it to His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished.” And He bowed His head and gave up His spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since it was the Day of Preparation, to prevent bodies from remaining on the cross on the Sabbath day (for that Sabbath day was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was dead already, they did not break His legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who saw it has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth, that you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things happened so that the Scripture should be fulfilled, “Not one of His bones shall be broken,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and again another Scripture says, “They shall look on Him whom they have pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took away His body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, weighing about seventy-five pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in linen cloths with the spices, as is the burial custom of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had ever been buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So because of the Jewish Day of Preparation, and since the tomb was nearby, they buried Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb while it was still dark and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she came running to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter came out with the other disciple and they went toward the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stooping down and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying. Yet he did not enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went inside the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cloth that was around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but wrapped in a place by itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who came first to the tomb, went in also. He saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary stood outside at the tomb weeping. As she wept, she stooped down and looked into the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she saw two angels in white sitting where the body of Jesus had lain, one at the head and one at the feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?”
She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, but she did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?”
Supposing Him to be the gardener, she said to Him, “Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have put Him, and I will take Him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to her, “Mary.”
She turned and said to Him, “Rabboni!” (which means Teacher).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Stop holding on to Me, for I have not yet ascended to My Father. But go to My brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, to My God and your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord and that He had said these things to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the evening of that first day of the week, the doors being locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. The disciples were then glad when they saw the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. As My Father has sent Me, even so I send you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive the sins of anyone, they are forgiven them. If you retain the sins of anyone, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called The Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!”
But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail prints in His hands, and put my finger in the nail prints, and put my hand in His side, I will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After eight days His disciples were again inside with the doors shut, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came and stood among them, and said, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at My hands. Put your hand here and place it in My side. Do not be faithless, but believing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas answered Him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have yet believed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are written that you might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus revealed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. He revealed Himself this way:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter; Thomas, called The Twin; Nathanael of Cana in Galilee; the sons of Zebedee; and two more of His disciples were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” Then they said to him, “We will go with you.” They went out and immediately entered the boat. But that night they caught nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the morning came, Jesus stood on the shore. But the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Children, do you have any fish?”
They answered Him, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Throw the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw it, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the abundance of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment, for he had taken it off, and jumped into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other disciples came in the little boat, dragging the net full of fish. For they were not far from land, but about three hundred feet away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to land, they saw a charcoal fire there with fish lying on it, and bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter went up and dragged the net, full of one hundred and fifty-three large fish, to land. Although there were so many, the net was not torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” None of the disciples dared ask, “Who are You?” They knew it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was now the third time that Jesus was revealed to His disciples after He was raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?”
He said to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I love You.”
He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?”
He said to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I love You.”
He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?”
Peter was grieved because He asked him the third time, “Do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Lord, You know everything. You know that I love You.”
Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, when you were young, you dressed yourself and walked where you desired. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you and carry you where you do not want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When He had said this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned and saw following them the disciple whom Jesus loved, who also leaned against His bosom at the supper and had said, “Lord, who is it that is going to betray You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw him, he said to Jesus, “Lord, what about this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If it is My will that he remain until I come, what is that to you? Follow Me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The saying went out among the brothers that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If it is My will that he remain until I come, what is that to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did. Were every one of them to be written, I suppose that not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
